Class Player

java.lang.Object
  GameObject
      Actor
          Player

public class Player
extends Actor

Player (pacman) is the object controlled by the human playing the game Player is a subclass of Actor

Author:
Ramsey Kant

Method Detail

incrementScore

public void incrementScore(int amt)
Increment score by amount. The is the current level score, not the entire session score This function is typically called inside an Item's use() function when the player picks up an item like a dot

Parameters:
amt - Amount to increment

getScore

public int getScore()
Get the current level score of the player

Returns:
the score

isPoweredUp

public boolean isPoweredUp()
Returns the isPowered flag which determines whether or not the player is powered up and invicible to ghosts

Returns:
True if the player is powered up

setPowerUp

public void setPowerUp(boolean x)
Set powered up state and start the expirtation time for when the powerup wears off

Parameters:
x - True if powered up, false if otherwise
See Also:
isPoweredUp()

act

public void act()
Player act() method This should evaluate if there is: - a collission with a ghost and how to handle that interaction - a dot or cherry being eaten (call use() on the item) - a next movement

Overrides:
act in class Actor
See Also:
GameObject.act(), StateGame.logic(), AIManager.process()
